repository.corpname: Washington State University Libraries, Manuscripts, Archives and Special Collections

did.unittitle: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University Women's Center Papers
did.abstract: Promotional event material, newspaper clippings, photos, and meeting material related to the Women's Resource Center and it's various student committees and associations, ranging from about 1957-2003.

bioghist.p: In fall of 1974, the Washington State University Women’s Center open on campus in the Compton Union Building. Their goal was to provide a place where students, staff, and faculty could gather in a non-sexist environment. They initially offered a lending library, resources for locating and selecting local medical, social, and professional support, and hosted series of speakers and programming. In fall of 1988, it was combined with the Office of Programs for Women and reconstituted as the Women’s Resource and Research Center. In 1993 it was renamed Women’s Resource Center.

scopecontent.p: Primarily contains newspaper clippings, constituional documents, and promotional event material related to the Young Women's Christian Association (YWCA) of Washington State University from about 1957 to the 1980s. Other items include meeting minutes, agendas, and photos related to the Women's Resource Center and its student committees such as the Association of Pacific and Asian Women (APAW) and the Black Women's Caucus (BWC) from the 1980s to around 2003.

arrangement.p: This is an unprocessed collection. Any arrangement reflects either a pre-existing order from the records' creators or previous custodians, or preliminary sorting performed by staff.
Items are organized into files based on subject matter.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

prefercite.p: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University Women's Center Papers, 1957-2003 (UA2019-08)
Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries, Pullman, WA.

acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to WSU Libraries' MASC by Tomyia Wallace, an office assistant in the Womens' Center, on Dec. 5, 2019 and retained as UA2019-08.

accruals.p: More materials were expected in mid-2020, but the pandemic got in the way. Hold off on processing until we are able to determine if more materials are still coming.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
